definitions.definition: A syncretic , dualistic religion that combines elements of Zoroastrian , Christian , and Gnostic thought , founded by the Iranian prophet Mani in 3rd century AD.
A dualistic philosophy dividing the world between good and evil principles , or regarding matter as intrinsically evil and mind as intrinsically good.

main_definition: ( religion ) A syncretic , dualistic religion that combines elements of Zoroastrian , Christian , and Gnostic thought , founded by the Iranian prophet Mani in 3rd century AD.
secondary_definitions: ( philosophy ) A dualistic philosophy dividing the world between good and evil principles , or regarding matter as intrinsically evil and mind as intrinsically good.
